message: Adam, you will definitely want to check this out
It turns out Fabric is not what I thought it was. It's a scriptable ssh client. Way more useful than just a deployment tool
heh, Fabric: less annoying than argparse/optparse
Oh yea, I view Fabric a closer to Rake/Make: an easy way to version control and automate tasks for a project, that may be remote or local
it isn't exactly hard to be less annoying that argparse.
I wrote up a post about mixing in the Linode API to Fabric, to have easier naming/access to your hosts http://asktherelic.com/2011/02/17/dynamic-fabric-commands-for-managing-cloud-servers/
I love linode; those guys rock.
haha I love that "simpler than argparse" may be the main take away from the talk.
